trans-unit.source: Check Cloud Service Name Availability
trans-unit.target: Check Cloud Service Name Availability

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Check Hosted Service Name Availability</languageKeyword> operation checks for the availability of the specified cloud service name.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Check Hosted Service Name Availability</languageKeyword> operation checks for the availability of the specified cloud service name.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Check Hosted Service Name Availability</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Check Hosted Service Name Availability</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the cloud service name that you would like to use.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the cloud service name that you would like to use.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: GET
trans-unit.target: GET

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The format of the response body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the response body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements in the response body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements in the response body.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Result
trans-unit.target: Result

trans-unit.source: A boolean value that indicates whether the name is available for you to use.
trans-unit.target: A boolean value that indicates whether the name is available for you to use.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> if the name is available; otherwise <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> if the name is available; otherwise <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: For versions before 2013-03-01, the operation returned <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> for non-taken names even if they were reserved or profane.
trans-unit.target: For versions before 2013-03-01, the operation returned <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> for non-taken names even if they were reserved or profane.

trans-unit.source: With version headers of 2013-03-01 and later, the operation returns <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> for reserved or profane words.
trans-unit.target: With version headers of 2013-03-01 and later, the operation returns <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword> for reserved or profane words.

trans-unit.source: Reason
trans-unit.target: Reason

trans-unit.source: Indicates why the name cannot be used to create the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Indicates why the name cannot be used to create the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>HostedServiceAlreadyExists</languageKeyword> – returned if the cloud service name already exists.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>HostedServiceAlreadyExists</languageKeyword> – returned if the cloud service name already exists.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>HostedServiceNameNotValid</languageKeyword> – returned if the cloud service name uses unsupported characters, reserved words, or profane words.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>HostedServiceNameNotValid</languageKeyword> – returned if the cloud service name uses unsupported characters, reserved words, or profane words.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Reason</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Reason</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-03-01 or higher.
